semantiva.context_operations package

Submodules

semantiva.context_operations.context_observer module

class semantiva.context_operations.context_observer.ContextObserver

Bases: object

Class for managing and observing context updates within the semantic framework.

This class facilitates the tracking and updating of contextual information that may influence the behavior of data operations and algorithms.

update_context(key, value)

Update the context with a new key-value pair or modify an existing one.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – The key associated with the context value.

  • value (any) – The value to be stored in the context.

semantiva.context_operations.context_operations module

class semantiva.context_operations.context_operations.ContextOperation(logger=None)

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for defining operations on a context.

This class serves as a foundation for implementing specific operations that manipulate or utilize the context in various ways.

Parameters:

logger (Logger)

abstract get_created_keys()

Retrieve a list of context keys that will be created by this operation.

Returns:

A list of context keys that the operation will add or create

as a result of execution.

Return type:

List[str]

abstract get_required_keys()

Retrieve a list of context keys required by this operation.

Returns:

A list of context keys that the operation expects to be present

before execution.

Return type:

List[str]

abstract get_suppressed_keys()

Retrieve a list of context keys that will be suppressed or removed by this operation.

Returns:

A list of context keys that the operation will remove or render

obsolete during its execution.

Return type:

List[str]

logger: Logger
operate_context(context)

Execute the context operation.

Calls the subclass-implemented _operate_context method to perform the operation on the provided context.

Parameters:

context (ContextType) – The context to operate on.

Returns:

The result of the context operation.

Return type:

ContextType

class semantiva.context_operations.context_operations.ContextPassthrough(logger=None)

Bases: ContextOperation

A context operation that passes the context unchanged.

This class is used as a default context operation for nodes when no specific context operation is provided.

Parameters:

logger (Logger)

get_created_keys()

Since this operation does not create any new keys, it returns an empty list.

Return type:

List[str]

get_required_keys()

Since this operation does not require any specific keys, it returns an empty list.

Return type:

List[str]

get_suppressed_keys()

Since this operation does not suppress any keys, it returns an empty list.

Return type:

List[str]

semantiva.context_operations.context_types module

class semantiva.context_operations.context_types.ContextCollectionType(context_list=None)

Bases: ContextType

A specialized context type that stores and manages multiple ContextType instances.

This class extends ContextType but internally keeps a list of separate contexts. Each item in the collection is a ContextType, enabling parallel iteration with DataC subclasses that contain multiple data items.

Parameters:

context_list (List[ContextType] | None)

append(item)

Append a ContextType object to the end of this collecton.

Parameters:

item (ContextType) – The context to be appended.

Raises:

TypeError – If the provided item is not a ContextType instance.

Return type:

None

class semantiva.context_operations.context_types.ContextType(context_dict=None)

Bases: object

Represents a generic context within the framework.

This class serves as a container for storing and managing context-specific information, facilitating access and updates to context data.

Parameters:

context_dict (Dict | None)

_context_container

A dictionary that stores key-value pairs representing the context data.

Type:

dict

clear()

Clear all key-value pairs in the context.

This method resets the context to an empty state.

delete_value(key)

Remove a key-value pair from the context.

Parameters:

key (str) – The key to be removed from the context.

Raises:

KeyError – If the key does not exist in the context.

get_value(key)

Retrieve a value from the context using the specified key.

Parameters:

key (str) – The key associated with the desired value.

Returns:

The value corresponding to the key, or None if the key does not exist.

Return type:

Any

items()

Retrieve all key-value pairs in the context.

Returns:

A list of (key, value) tuples for the stored context data.

Return type:

list

keys()

Retrieve all keys in the context.

Returns:

A list of all keys currently stored in the context.

Return type:

list

set_value(key, value)

Set or update a value in the context.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – The key associated with the value to be stored.

  • value (Any) – The value to store in the context.

values()

Retrieve all values in the context.

Returns:

A list of all values currently stored in the context.

Return type:

list
